Day 1: Isolate T cells from OT-1 mice using T cell enrichment column and transfer 5-6 X 10<sup>6</sup> cells intravenously into CD45.1 mice.


Day

body:
Isolate MDSC from 3 week  tumor-bearing mice \(EL4 or MC38) using biotin-Gr-1 and streptavidin beads \(Miltenyi biotech, CA) antibody and  transfer 4-5 X 10<sup>6</sup> cells intravenously into mice which have received OT-1 T cells. Immunize mice with SIINFEKL peptide 100 ug in 100 ul PBS plus 100 ul of incomplete Freund’s adjuvant.


Day 10:
Harvest spleens from mice and prepare a single cell suspension.
Pellet the cells by centrifugation \(1700 RPM 5 min) at room temperature \(RT) and aspirate the supernatant.
Resuspend the pellet in 5 ml/spleen of ACK Lysis Buffer.
Incubate at RT for 4-5 minutes with occasional shaking.
Stop the reaction by adding 40-50 μl of PBS.
Wash the cells with PBS twice \(1700 RPM  5 min) at RT.
Use Cy5 \(Molecular probes, OR) labeled SIINKb-Ig and SIYKb-Ig dimers as specific and non-specific MHC-Ig ligands, respectively.
Prepare a serial dilution \(2000 nM – 12.5 nM) of 20 μl of Cy5 labeled MHC-Ig dimer in a FACS tube.
Adjust cells to a concentration of 10<sup>7</sup> cells/ml in FACS wash buffer
Add 10 ul aliquot of cells to the FACS tube with the MHC-Ig dimer.
Incubate cells with the MHC-Ig dimers for 60-90 min on ice.
Without any washing add FITC labeled anti-CD8 and PE labeled anti-CD45.1 antibodies to each aliquot.
Incubate cells for an additional 20 min on ice and wash two times before flow cytometric analysis.
Specific MHC-Ig staining is calculated by subtracting the non-specific MHC-Ig staining from the total MHC-Ig staining within the population of CD45.1 negative CD8 positive cells.
